meanings.definition: An upward trend or improvement in a situation.
meanings.sent1: The economy showed an upturn with more people finding jobs.
meanings.sent2: The stock market experienced an upturn after the new policy was announced.
meanings.sent3: The upturn in the number of sunny days made everyone happier.
meanings.sent4: Her mood took an upturn when she received good news from her friend.
meanings.sent5: The upturn in sales was a welcome relief for the struggling business.

meanings.definition: To turn or move in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: She had to upturn the bucket to empty its contents.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast had to upturn her body to perform the perfect flip.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally upturned the vase while reaching for a book.
meanings.sent4: The wind upturned the umbrella, causing it to fly away.
meanings.sent5: The chef upturned the cake onto a plate for serving.
